task.shortdesc: System administrators and messaging administrators can configure messaging users and groups by using the Users and Groups page in the .

taskbody.context:
You can use an external LDAP server to manage your messaging users and groups. For more information, see .
You can configure messaging users and groups by using the , or by using the command line. For more information about using the command line to configure messaging users and groups, see .For more information about the components that you must specify when you configure an messaging user or group, see .

step.cmd: Go to the Users and Groups page in one of the following ways:

choices.choice: From the Home tab, click Messaging Users and Groups in the Create users and groups pane.
From the Messaging menu, click Users and Groups.
To add a messaging group, click the Add icon.
To delete a messaging group, select the group and click the Delete icon.
To edit a messaging group, select the group and click the Edit icon.
To add a messaging user, click the Add icon.
To delete a messaging user, select the user and click the Delete icon.
To edit a messaging user, select the user and click the Edit icon.
To reset the password of a messaging user, select the user and click Other Actions > Reset Password.
